meanings.sent1: I used a cloth to dampen the spilled water on the table.
meanings.sent2: She used a sponge to dampen the soil before planting the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The rain threatened to dampen our picnic plans, but we found a sheltered spot.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was dampened by the unexpected delays.
meanings.sent5: The morning dew helped dampen the grass, creating a refreshing atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make less strong or intense.
meanings.sent1: Adding sugar can dampen the bitterness of the coffee.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds began to dampen the brightness of the sunny day.
meanings.sent3: His jokes never fail to dampen the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The criticism did nothing to dampen her determination to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The music was played softly to dampen the impact on the sleeping baby.

meanings.sent1: He tried to dampen his anger before speaking to his boss.
meanings.sent2: The security measures were in place to dampen any potential threats.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but dampen her excitement when she saw the long queue.
meanings.sent4: The medication helped dampen the symptoms of the illness.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules were meant to dampen any rebellious behavior among the students.
